intro: Agalinis nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's bluetail, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive blue or purple hue at the base. Its flowering period usually occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in disturbed or wetland habitats. Agalinis nuttallii is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological diversity.
